workout_title: Biceps Peak and Back Definition Workout

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.
Swing arms forward and backward, opening up the chest. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hands on hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Twist the torso from side to side, keeping the hips stable. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Get on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching the back (cat) and dropping the belly (cow). Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds.
Swing arms across the body and then out to the sides. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds.
Rotate wrists in both directions. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
2. Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight and elbows pointed down.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
4. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at the lat pull-down machine with a neutral grip attachment.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the attachment with palms facing each other.
2. Pull the attachment down to your upper chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 8-10 reps with proper form, similar to the main exercise.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on engaging your lats and avoid using momentum to pull the bar down.

exercises.setup: Use a chest-supported row machine or incline bench.
execution: 1. Position your chest against the pad and grip the handles.
2. Pull the weight towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at a cable row machine with a straight bar or V-bar attachment.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the attachment and sit with your back straight.
2. Pull the attachment towards your lower chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 8-10 reps with proper form, similar to the main exercise.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your chest pressed against the pad to prevent using your lower back.

exercises.setup: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm.
execution: 1. Sit at the preacher bench and place your upper arms on the pad.
2. Grip the barbell or dumbbell with palms facing up.
3. Curl the weight up towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the cable handle with both hands.
2. Curl the handle towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 10-12 reps with proper form, similar to the main exercise.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on keeping your elbows locked in place to maximize tension on the biceps.

exercises.setup: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward.
execution: 1. Grip the cable handle with both hands.
2. Curl the handle towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit on an incline bench with dumbbells in each hand.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Sit back on the incline bench with arms hanging down.
2. Curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 10-12 reps with proper form, similar to the main exercise.
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure a full range of motion to maximize the stretch and tension on the biceps.
